Container.Name: binhex-deluge
Container.Overview: Deluge is a full-featured BitTorrent client for Linux, OS X, Unix and Windows. It uses libtorrent in its backend and features multiple user-interfaces including: GTK+, web and console. It has been designed using the client server model with a daemon process that handles all the bittorrent activity. The Deluge daemon is able to run on headless machines with the user-interfaces being able to connect remotely from any platform.
Container.DonateText: If you appreciate my work, then please consider buying me a beer :D

Config.Name: Port: Web Interface
Config.Description: This is the Web UI port for for the application.

Config.Name: Port: Deluge daemon
Config.Description: This is the port used by the Deluge daemon.

Config.Name: Port: Incoming port (TCP)
Config.Description: This port can be used as an TCP incoming port.

Config.Name: Port: Incoming port (UDP)
Config.Description: This port can be used as an UDP incoming port.

Config.Name: Path: /config
Config.Description: This is the container path to your configuration files, e.g. databases, configuration files, logs etc.

Config.Name: Path: /data
Config.Description: This is the container path to your downloaded files or user created content.

Config.Name: Variable: DELUGE_DAEMON_LOG_LEVEL
Config.Description: Specify the level of logging for the Deluge daemon, valid levels are: info, warning, error, none, debug, trace, garbage.

Config.Name: Variable: DELUGE_WEB_LOG_LEVEL
Config.Description: Specify the level of logging for the Deluge daemon, valid levels are: info, warning, error, none, debug, trace, garbage.

Config.Name: Variable: GLUETUN_INCOMING_PORT
Config.Description: Specify whether to attempt to identify and configure the applications listening port when connected to the gluetun network.

Config.Name: Variable: GLUETUN_CONTROL_SERVER_PORT
Config.Description: Specify the port for the gluetun HTTP Control Server.

Config.Name: Variable: GLUETUN_CONTROL_SERVER_USERNAME
Config.Description: Specify the username for the gluetun HTTP Control Server

Config.Name: Variable: GLUETUN_CONTROL_SERVER_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Specify the password for the gluetun HTTP Control Server

Config.Name: Variable: WEBUI_PORT
Config.Description: Specify the port the application will listen on - IMPORTANT: If you change this value then you will also need to delete and re-create the port mapping to match.

Config.Name: Variable: DEBUG
Config.Description: Specify whether you want to enable debug logging, useful when diagnosing gluetune related issues.

Config.Name: Variable: ENABLE_HEALTHCHECK
Config.Description: Enable or disable healthchecks.

Config.Name: Variable: HEALTHCHECK_COMMAND
Config.Description: The command to execute in the healthcheck script, if not specified this will be DNS and HTTPS checks against google.com.

Config.Name: Variable: HEALTHCHECK_ACTION
Config.Description: The action to execute if the healthcheck command returns a non zero exit code, if not specified the action will be 'exit 1', if you want the container to exit on failure then set the action to 'kill 1'.

Config.Name: Variable: HEALTHCHECK_HOSTNAME
Config.Description: The hostname used when performing HTTPS and DNS healthchecking.

Config.Name: Variable: PUID
Config.Description: User ID for the running container

Config.Name: Variable: PGID
Config.Description: Group ID for the running container

Config.Name: Variable: UMASK
Config.Description: UMASK for the running container
